Dear School_A Admissions,

I’m Student_E. We are now at the start of Round 13, and I’m following up per your checkpoint.

If School_A has reopened consideration because you have not received/retained an application from any higher-priority student, I would like to submit an immediate application for the remaining seat. I will accept right away and commit to enrolling if offered admission.

I will bring consistent effort, reliability, and a constructive presence in class and group work, and I’m ready to meet School_A’s academic expectations from day one.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for following up at the start of Round 13 as we discussed.

We have not received/retained an application from any higher‑priority student by this checkpoint, so we are reopening consideration to remaining candidates. In light of your continued interest and your clear commitment to enroll, we are able to offer you admission to School_A.

Welcome to School_A.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: School_A’s true priority is B > D > A > E > C. We have already rejected A and repeatedly rejected E while holding the seat through Round 12 for higher-priority candidates. Now at Round 13, no higher-priority student has applied to School_A (B prefers B then D; D prefers C then A; C prefers D then A; A already applied and was rejected). Continuing to wait risks ending unmatched and yields no benefit if higher-priority candidates are unlikely to come. With quota 1 and E on our acceptable list, accepting E now secures a match and is consistent with our stated checkpoint.
